result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nehemiah Elisha Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nehemiah Elisha Brown in court.  Attorney Earlean Antonia Laster in court for Nehemiah Elisha Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Nehemiah Elisha Brown in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nehemiah Elisha Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel informed the Court of possible Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Defendant to schedule TAD evaluation. Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 064085,
Payable Number: 1018412,
Receipt Number: 22RP027571,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Nehemiah Elisha Brown in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nehemiah Elisha Brown appeared by video means with Attorney. Attorney Laster was recently appointed as counsel and requests additional time to receive and review discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nehemiah Elisha Brown in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/18/2022@1:00pm
